page.title: 19Two clubs in Cotteridge
page.content: I go to{boxing}twice a week. It costs fifty pence each night for about three hours. My trainer is Paddy Benson. We do{excercises}such as press ups, tuck jumps, squat thrusts and snake dives. There are two types of guard used when boxing, called South Paw and Orthodox. {I am a south paw}which means that I lead with my right and follow up with my left. About twenty people go to the boxing club. Most are teenagers. The club starts at 6 pm and is held in a hall behind Kings Norton Library. The club is called{The Alpha Club.}When we are twelve years old we become{amateur fighters}and enter exhibitions. I belong to the{TSB Club.}It costs 50p to start an account. It is an idea to {help children to save.}If I want to save more money I fill in a form for the cashier who types it into my book. It tells me how much I have saved.
